query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Né ’l dir l’andar, né l’andar lui più lento 2 facea, ma ragionando andavam forte, 3 sì come nave pinta da buon vento;
query.error: **English:** 1 Neither the going, nor the going more slowly, 2 made him speak, but reasoning they went strongly, 3 like a ship driven by a good wind;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 e l’ombre, che parean cose rimorte, 5 per le fosse de li occhi ammirazione 6 traean di me, di mio vivere accorte.
query.error: **English:** 4 and the shades, who seemed dead things, 5 through the sockets of their eyes drew 6 admiration from me, aware of my living.
query.result: 4 and ða scadu, þe ðuhte ðing deadra, 5 ðurh ða holan ðara eagna hyra 6 wundra getealdon, mines lifes georne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 E io, continüando al mio sermone, 8 dissi: «Ella sen va sù forse più tarda 9 che non farebbe, per altrui cagione.
query.error: **English:** 7 And I, continuing my speech, 8 said: "She is perhaps going up later 9 than she would, because of another reason.
query.result: 7 And ic ða furðor ðinum wordum cwæð, 8 "Heo gæð nu uppon sumre sæle lætre 9 ðonne heo ær dyde, for ðære ðearfe ðe heo hæfð."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Ma dimmi, se tu sai, dov’ è Piccarda; 11 dimmi s’io veggio da notar persona 12 tra questa gente che sì mi riguarda».
query.error: **English:** 10 But tell me, if you know, where is Piccarda; 11 tell me if I see anyone worthy of note 12 among these people who are watching me so intently.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 «La mia sorella, che tra bella e buona 14 non so qual fosse più, trïunfa lieta 15 ne l’alto Olimpo già di sua corona».
query.error: **English:** 13 "My sister, who between beautiful and good 14 I do not know which was more, triumphs joyful 15 in high Olympus already with her crown."
query.result: 13 "Min sweoster, ðe betwux fæger and god 14 nis me ðæs soð to secganne hwæðer wæs mare, 15 on ðam hean heofone nu hire blisse brucað."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Sì disse prima; e poi: «Qui non si vieta 17 di nominar ciascun, da ch’è sì munta 18 nostra sembianza via per la dïeta.

query.result: 16 Swa cwæð he ærest; and ða eft: "Her nis nân ðearf 17 ðæt ænig mon his naman ne cunne, 18 forðæm ðe ure hiw bið forwandod ðurh ðone wæstm."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Molti altri mi nomò ad uno ad uno; 26 e del nomar parean tutti contenti, 27 sì ch’io però non vidi un atto bruno.
query.error: **English:** 25 Many others he named to me, one by one; 26 and they all seemed content to be named, 27 so that I did not see a single frown.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Vidi per fame a vòto usar li denti 29 Ubaldin da la Pila e Bonifazio 30 che pasturò col rocco molte genti.
query.error: **English:** 28 I saw Ubaldin della Pila and Bonifazio 29 gnawing at each other in their hunger, 30 he who shepherded many people with his crook.
query.result: 28 Ic geseah ðurh hungor Ubaldin ðone 29 and Bonifacium ðone bisceop 30 se ðe mid gyrde manega gehæfde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Vidi messer Marchese, ch’ebbe spazio 32 già di bere a Forlì con men secchezza, 33 e sì fu tal, che non si sentì sazio.
query.error: **English:** 31 I saw Messer Marchese, who had the opportunity 32 to drink in Forlì with less dryness, 33 and he was such that he did not feel satisfied.
query.result: 31 Ic geseah ðone æðelan Marchese, se hæfde ðone sped 32 ðæt he moste drincan æt Forlì mid læsse ðurste, 33 and he wæs swylc ðæt he ne mæg næfre beon gefylled.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Ma come fa chi guarda e poi s’apprezza 35 più d’un che d’altro, fei a quel da Lucca, 36 che più parea di me aver contezza.
query.error: **English:** 34 But as one does who looks and then draws near 35 more to one than to another, I did to that one from Lucca, 36 who seemed to have more knowledge of me.
query.result: 34 Ac swa swa ðeð ðe lociað and ðonne genealæcað 35 ma ðonne to ðam oðrum ðonne to ðam ðriddan, dyde ic to ðam of Luca, 36 ðe me ðuhte ðæt he me bet cuðe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 37 He murnede; and ic nat hwet "Gentucca" 38 ic ðær gehyrde, ðær he ða wunde 39 ðære rihtwisnesse ðe swa ða ruggeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 «O anima», diss’ io, «che par sì vaga 41 di parlar meco, fa sì ch’io t’intenda, 42 e te e me col tuo parlare appaga».
query.error: **English:** 40 "O soul," I said, "who seem so eager 41 to speak with me, do so that I may understand you, 42 and satisfy both you and me with your speech."
query.result: 40 "Eala ðu sawul," cwæð ic, "ðe ðinceð swa gewis 41 ðæt ðu wille sprecan wið me, wyrc swa ðæt ic ðe gehyre, 42 and geðwær ðe and me mid ðinum wordum."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 43 "Wifmon is geboren, and ne gæð giet ða gyt," 44 ongan he, "ðe ðe ðine wille bringð, 45 ðine burge ðe ðeah mon mænige tæle."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Tu te n’andrai con questo antivedere: 47 se nel mio mormorar prendesti errore, 48 dichiareranti ancor le cose vere.
query.error: **English:** 46 You will depart with this foreknowledge: 47 if you misunderstood my murmuring, 48 true things will still declare it to you.
query.result: 46 ðu ðe scealt faran mid ðysum foresceawunge: 47 gif ðu on minum murcunge miswende, 48 ðe secgað ða soðan ðing.

49 Ma dì s’i’ veggio qui colui che fore 50 trasse le nove rime, cominciando 51 ‘Donne ch’avete intelletto d’amore’».
